citation.article-title: Reclassification of Cytophaga aprica (Lewin 1969) Reichenbach 1989 in Flammeovirga gen. nov., as Flammeovirga aprica comb. nov. and of Cytophaga diffluens (ex Stanier 1949; emend Lewin 1969) Reichenbach 1989 in Persicobacter gen. nov., as Persicobacter diffluens comb. nov.

p.s: Flammeovirga (Flam. me.o.vir'ga. L. adj. flammeus, fire colored; L. fem. n. virga, rod; L. fem. n. Flammeovirga, fire-colored rod)
Cells are long and flexible rods that are 0.5 to 0.7 μm wide and 6 to 30 μm long.
Cell mass is orange to reddish orange.
Strict aerobes with a respiratory type of metabolism.
All strains of the type species decompose alginate, agar, gelatin, and starch but not crystalline cellulose.
The major isoprenoid quinone is MK-7.
The G+C content of the DNA is 35 to 37 mol%.
The type species of the genus is Flammeovirga aprica comb. nov.
The description of F. aprica is the same as that given by Reichenbach (20).
